definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: The garter stitch is used after all your rows are done using a knit stitch.
sentences.chinese: 襪帶針後，使用所有的行都是使用一針針織。

sentences.english: My husband bought me a new garter belt yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我先生昨天買給我新的吊襪帶。

sentences.english: Still got that knife in your garter?
sentences.chinese: 你的吊襪帶裏仍舊還有那把勾刀嗎？

sentences.english: Helen allowed Paris to take her garter.
sentences.chinese: 海倫讓帕里斯拿走了她的襪帶。

sentences.english: The one who catches it is supposed to be the next groom.
sentences.chinese: 抓到襪帶的人就該是下一個做新郎的人。

sentences.english: Sometimes the groom throws the bride's garter to the unmarried men.
sentences.chinese: 有時，新郎把新娘的襪帶扔向未婚男人們。

sentences.english: Rich takes off Cath 's garter and throws it.
sentences.chinese: 李奇會脫掉卡西的吊襪帶，然後丟出去。

sentences.english: "Don't come so near me, " said the garter;
sentences.chinese: 不過襪帶是非常害羞的。

sentences.english: Garters have become out of fashion.
